New Records: South Africa recorded the lowest total successfully defended in T20 World Cup history as Bangladesh squandered a huge chance to record their first win over the Proteas.
Tanzid Hasan snapped his third wicket in the Powerplay with the wicket of Tristan Stubbs.
Key Match Events: South Africa pipped Bangladesh for a thrilling four-run win at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York on Monday.
Tanzid Hasan skids through a wicket-maiden in the Powerplay.

Taskin Ahmed skids one through and zips the ball just past Markram's outside-edge to the keeper.
Quinton de Kock was knocked over by Tanzid Hasan.
Heinrich Klaasen is in at 5 after the wicket of Aiden Markram.
David Miller is in at 6 after the wicket of Tristan Stubbs.
Towhid Hridoy and Mahmudullah took the fight deep but South Africa held their nerve to dismiss both batters to secure their third successive win.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh ended a 17-year drought when they beat Sri Lanka on Saturday.
Shakib Al Hasan needs three wickets to become the first bowler to pick 50 T20 World Cup wickets.
Shakib Al Hasan needs only four wickets to become the second man to take 150 T20I wickets.
Mustafizur Rahman is undoubtedly the vital cog for Bangladesh with the ball.
Heinrich Klaasen has not been able to light up the tournament yet but this might just be the day where the hard-hitting batter gets back to his best.
